Rest API documentation¶

This documentation provides an overview of the FastAPI application, including API endpoints, repository interactions, services, database, and schemas.

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

Contents:

  • src

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)[source]¶

Lifespan event to initialize Redis connection.

async main.rate_limit_handler(request: Request, exc: RateLimitExceeded)[source]¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

class src.repository.contacts.ContactRepository(session: AsyncSession)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles database operations for the Contact model.

async create_contact(body: ContactBase, user: User) → Contact[source]¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body – A ContactBase object containing contact details.

  • user – The owner of the new contact.

Returns:

The newly created Contact object.

async get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact | None[source]¶

Retrieve a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user – The owner of the contact.

Returns:

The Contact object if found, otherwise None.

async get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User) → List[Contact][source]¶

Retrieve a paginated list of contacts owned by a user.

Parameters:

  • skip – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user – The owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of Contact objects.

async get_week_birthdays(days: int, user: User) → List[Contact][source]¶

Retrieve contacts whose birthdays fall within the next given number of days.

Parameters:

  • days – The number of days to check for upcoming birthdays.

  • user – The owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of Contact objects with birthdays within the given range.

async remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact | None[source]¶

Delete a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user – The owner of the contact.

Returns:

The deleted Contact object if found, otherwise None.

async search_contacts(search: str, skip: int, limit: int, user: User) → List[Contact][source]¶

Search for contacts by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • search – The search query string.

  • skip – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user – The owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of matching Contact objects.

async update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactBase, user: User) → Contact | None[source]¶

Update a contact’s details.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body – A ContactBase object with updated contact details.

  • user – The owner of the contact.

Returns:

The updated Contact object if found, otherwise None.

Handles database operations for the User model.

Confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

email – The email of the user to confirm.

Returns:

None

async create_user(body: UserCreate, avatar: str = None) → User[source]¶

Create a new user.

Parameters:

  • body – A UserCreate object containing user details.

  • avatar – An optional avatar URL for the user.

Returns:

The newly created User object.

async get_user_by_email(email: str) → User | None[source]¶

Retrieve a user by their email address.

Parameters:

email – The email of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

async get_user_by_id(user_id: int) → User | None[source]¶

Retrieve a user by their ID.

Parameters:

user_id – The ID of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

async get_user_by_username(username: str) → User | None[source]¶

Retrieve a user by their username.

Parameters:

username – The username of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

async update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str) → User[source]¶

Update the avatar URL of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – The email of the user whose avatar is to be updated.

  • url – The new avatar URL.

Returns:

The updated User object.

async update_user_role(user: User, role: UserRole)[source]¶

Update the role of a user.

Parameters:

  • user – The user object whose role is being updated.

  • role – The new role to be assigned to the user.

Returns:

The updated user object with the new role.

REST API services¶

class src.services.auth.Hash[source]¶

Bases: object

Utility class for password hashing and verification using bcrypt.

get_password_hash(password: str)[source]¶

Hash a password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password – The plain text password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password string.

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)[source]¶

Verify a plain text password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if passwords match, otherwise False.

async src.services.auth.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: int | None = None)[source]¶

Generate a new JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • data – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta – Optional expiration time in seconds.

Returns:

Encoded JWT token as a string.

src.services.auth.create_email_token(data: dict)[source]¶

Create an email verification token.

Parameters:

data – The data to encode in the token.

Returns:

Encoded JWT token as a string.

src.services.auth.create_reset_password_token(data: dict, expires_delta: int = 3600)[source]¶

Creates a JWT token for password reset (valid for 1 hour).

Parameters:

  • data – Data to encode (user’s email).

  • expires_delta – Token expiration time (default: 1 hour).

Returns:

A string containing the JWT token.

async src.services.auth.get_current_admin_user(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Dependency that ensures the current user has admin privileges.

Parameters:

current_user – The authenticated user retrieved via dependency injection.

Returns:

The user object if they have admin privileges.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not have admin rights.

async src.services.auth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Retrieve the current authenticated user from the cache or database.

Parameters:

  • token – OAuth2 access token.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

The authenticated User object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or user is not found.

async src.services.auth.get_email_from_reset_token(token: str)[source]¶

Decodes the JWT token and extracts the user’s email.

Parameters:

token – The password reset token.

Returns:

The user’s email.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or expired.

async src.services.auth.get_email_from_token(token: str)[source]¶

Extract the email from an email verification token.

Parameters:

token – JWT token containing the email.

Returns:

The extracted email string.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

class src.services.contacts.ContactService(db: AsyncSession)[source]¶

Bases: object

Service layer for handling contact-related operations.

async create_contact(body: ContactBase, user: User)[source]¶

Create a new contact for the given user.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase object containing contact details.

  • user – The authenticated user creating the contact.

Returns:

The newly created contact object.

async get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User)[source]¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user – The authenticated user retrieving the contact.

Returns:

The contact object if found, otherwise None.

async get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User)[source]¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for the given user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user – The authenticated user retrieving the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contact objects.

async get_week_birthdays(days: int, user: User)[source]¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays within a given number of days.

Parameters:

  • days – The number of days to check for upcoming birthdays.

  • user – The authenticated user retrieving the birthday list.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

async remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User)[source]¶

Delete a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user – The authenticated user deleting the contact.

Returns:

The deleted contact object if found, otherwise None.

async search_contacts(search: int, skip: int, limit: int, user: User)[source]¶

Search for contacts based on a query string.

Parameters:

  • search – The search query string.

  • skip – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user – The authenticated user performing the search.

Returns:

A list of matching contact objects.

async update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactBase, user: User)[source]¶

Update an existing contact for the given user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body – ContactBase object containing updated details.

  • user – The authenticated user updating the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact object if found, otherwise None.

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Send a confirmation email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email – The recipient’s email address.

  • username – The username of the recipient.

  • host – The host URL for generating the verification link.

Returns:

None

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue sending the email.

async src.services.email.send_reset_password_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Sends a password reset email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email – The recipient’s email address.

  • username – The recipient’s username.

  • host – The base URL for generating the password reset link.

Returns:

None

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue sending the email.

Service for handling file uploads to Cloudinary.

static upload_file(file, username) → str[source]¶

Upload a file to Cloudinary and return its URL.

Parameters:

  • file – The file object to be uploaded.

  • username – The username used to generate a unique public ID.

Returns:

The URL of the uploaded image.

class src.services.cache.RedisCache[source]¶

Bases: object

Service for caching user data in Redis.

Establish connection with Redis.

async delete_user(user_id: int)[source]¶

Remove user from cache.

Parameters:

user_id – ID of the user to delete from cache.

async get_user(user_id: int) → User | None[source]¶

Retrieve user from Redis cache.

Parameters:

user_id – ID of the user.

Returns:

User object if found, otherwise None.

async set_user(user: User, ttl: int = 3600)[source]¶

Cache the user data in Redis.

Parameters:

  • user – User object to cache.

  • ttl – Time to live for the cache (default: 1 hour).

REST API database¶

class src.database.db.DatabaseSessionManager(url: str)[source]¶

Bases: object

Manages database sessions using SQLAlchemy’s async engine.

session()[source]¶

Provide a database session using an async context manager.

Yields:

An active database session.

Raises:

  • Exception – If the database session is not initialized.

  • SQLAlchemyError – If an error occurs during session operations.

async src.database.db.get_db()[source]¶

Dependency function to get a database session.

Yields:

An active database session.

REST API schemas¶

class src.schemas.contacts.ContactBase(*, first_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)], last_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)], email: EmailStr, phone_number: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=6), MaxLen(max_length=20)], birthday: date, additional_data: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=200)])[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base schema for a contact, used for creating and updating contacts.

classmethod validate_birthday(value)[source]¶

Validates that the birthday is not in the future.

Parameters:

value – The provided birth date.

Returns:

The validated birth date.

Raises:

ValueError – If the birthday is in the future.

REST API configuration¶

class src.conf.config.Settings(_case_sensitive: bool | None = None, _nested_model_default_partial_update: bool | None = None, _env_prefix: str | None = None, _env_file: DotenvType | None = WindowsPath('.'), _env_file_encoding: str | None = None, _env_ignore_empty: bool | None = None, _env_nested_delimiter: str | None = None, _env_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _env_parse_enums: bool | None = None, _cli_prog_name: str | None = None, _cli_parse_args: bool | list[str] | tuple[str, ...] | None = None, _cli_settings_source: CliSettingsSource[Any] | None = None, _cli_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _cli_hide_none_type: bool | None = None, _cli_avoid_json: bool | None = None, _cli_enforce_required: bool | None = None, _cli_use_class_docs_for_groups: bool | None = None, _cli_exit_on_error: bool | None = None, _cli_prefix: str | None = None, _cli_flag_prefix_char: str | None = None, _cli_implicit_flags: bool | None = None, _cli_ignore_unknown_args: bool | None = None, _cli_kebab_case: bool | None = None, _secrets_dir: PathType | None = None, *, DB_URL: str, JWT_SECRET: str, JWT_ALGORITHM: str, JWT_EXPIRATION_SECONDS: int, MAIL_USERNAME: EmailStr, MAIL_PASSWORD: str, MAIL_FROM: EmailStr, MAIL_PORT: int, MAIL_SERVER: str, MAIL_FROM_NAME: str, MAIL_STARTTLS: bool = False, MAIL_SSL_TLS: bool = True, USE_CREDENTIALS: bool = True, VALIDATE_CERTS: bool = True, CLD_NAME: str, CLD_API_KEY: int, CLD_API_SECRET: str, REDIS_HOST: str, REDIS_PORT: int, REDIS_DB: int)[source]¶

Bases: BaseSettings

Defines the application settings using Pydantic’s BaseSettings. Values are loaded from environment variables and an optional .env file.
